title: Search Committee
description: The Scranton branch puts together a search committee to find the next boss, but the pool of interviewees proves to be less than impressive, and Dwight demands an interview in spite of his gun accident.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [drives up to the entrance of the building, his license plate reads "NEW MGR"] It's a beautiful morning at Dunder-Mifflin, or as I like to call it, Great Bratton. [gets out of car, tosses his keys toward a nonexistent valet parker] Keep it running.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Do I love being manager?... I love my kids. I love real estate. [slowly getting more excited] I love ceramics. I love my job. I-I love wrestling.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [to Jordan] Find out what language this is. [speaking in strange language]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [running a meeting in the conference room] Okay, team building! On this side of the room, Stanley, Phyllis, Jim, Ted, Elroy, [camera switches to show only Meredith and Kevin have attended the meeting, Jim walks by and sees this] and this side of the room, Pam, Meredith, Phyllis, Creed...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He never called a meeting.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [pointing at a whiteboard with BOBODDY written on the left side, vertically] BO-BODDY! BO-BODDY. What does the first "B" stand for?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are we doing?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: We're making acronyms. Okay! What does the first "B" stand for?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Um... Business!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I like it! Business! Good, Kevin! [writes after the first B, I, Z, N, U...] All right! The "O"...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We need a new manager.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [conducting interview] Your paper experience is very interesting. Do you think you could use that experience to inform decisions here?

quotes.speaker: Fred
quotes.text: Absolutely-I, yes. In fact, I actually have a three-step plan that I believe could effectively double your profits.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Fred
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [waiting for Fred to continue] ...What is it?

quotes.speaker: Fred
quotes.text: Nice try.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I'm sorry, what is your three-step plan?

quotes.speaker: Fred
quotes.text: Well, I mean, I can't just hand you my plan. I mean, if you guys give me the job, then, then you'll get the plan.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Well... it's an interview, and we don't know that you really have the plan.

quotes.speaker: Fred
quotes.text: [speaking faster] Well, I'm not gonna just make up that I have a plan. I got a plan. Believe me, you guys want it. You're in paper, right?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: How would we know that, if you don't...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You could just be saying it to get the job.

quotes.speaker: Fred
quotes.text: I guess I could be, if I was... who would do that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How about this. Why don't you give us a part of the plan, and that way we know you have it.

quotes.speaker: Fred
quotes.text: Tell you what. I'll give you part three of part two. Not gonna give you a whole part.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Fred
quotes.text: Color-code sent documents, TM.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did you just trademark that...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [confused] W-What?

quotes.speaker: Fred
quotes.text: That's a verbal trademark. That's an agreement.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We are the Search Committee, hand-picked by our CEO, and tasked to find this branch's new manager. Not everyone we meet will be good, but someone's bound to be, right? [Andy, Kelly, and Darryl are each dressed up in suits for their interviews, Andy is also wearing an "Andy for Manager?" pin on his jacket] And, to be honest, I think a lot of the decent candidates are right here in-house, so, I'm not too worried. But I'm really excited to spend a lot of time with Toby and Gabe. [quietly] Did you know that Gabe's last name was Lewis? I had no idea.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [in elevator with Phyllis and Darryl, all three are smiling, to Darryl] Good morning.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Good morning.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [also to Darryl] Good morning.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Good morning.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Did you have a nice drive in?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I did.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I have a solid relationship with Jo, the company's owner. I have management experience. I have a good friendship with Jim, the head of the Search Committee, and it doesn't hurt that I'm... [in Oprah-like sing-song voice] bla-aaack!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [puts up a poster in the break room with "IF YOU ARE ON THE SEARCH COMMITTEE PLEASE CONSIDER ANDY" on it in bold lettering]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [commenting on the poster] It's good. I really hope you get it!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: The manager job? Nah, I'm barely interested. I just can't not go for it. You know, it's not the Bernard way. We give it the old college try, and then, in defeat, we show grace.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Still, I'd really like to see this office with you in the boss's chair.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Don't even... [getting really happy and excited] EEEHHHH!!!!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You in the boss's chair!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: EEEHHH!! No. Hehe.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: In my family, you don't really go out and get things. If you want something, you write it on a list, and then the housekeeper goes out and gets it, on Wednesdays and Fridays. So, I don't know, I guess you could say this job is on my list, and... [awkwardly smiling] we'll see what Rosa comes back with.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [checks to see that she is alone with Phyllis] Did you hear anything?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sure they'll let us know when they get the results. [Erin crosses fingers and smiles excitedly]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It turns out that Erin was born in the basic time and region that I gave away a child.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: So, Phyllis might be my mom. I mean, the chances are tiny, but...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: But, probably not, I mean, it was a big year for babies. Porky's had come out.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah. I'm sure I was just another Porky's baby.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Mm.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: But why not find out.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Dwight, who is reading the want ads] Should you really be so blatant about that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They won't make me manager, and I won't settle for anything less. I've gone about as far as I can here. That's obvious. Time to take my talents elsewhere.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you really going to apply for work at Scranton Breadworks?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Bread is the paper of the food industry. You write your sandwich on it.

quotes.speaker: Warren
quotes.text: Can you do any better on salary?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Unfortunately, that range is set at corporate.

quotes.speaker: Warren
quotes.text: What about mileage when I use my car? I mean, gas ain't cheap, you know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Heh. We think that 25 cents a mile is pretty generous.

quotes.speaker: Warren
quotes.text: How about 27? And uh, when I make long-distance calls, will they be monitored or is it on the honor system?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [on phone] Okay. [hangs up, smiling] How odd, a very unusual phone call from the Senator's office. The Senator wants me to have lunch with him at The Botanical Gardens.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: The Botanical Gardens, Scranton's hidden gem. Don't eat any berries you don't recognize.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: How will your experience selling refinery equipment translate to our smaller scale here?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: You don't work in sales, do you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Uh... Human Resources.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: You see, I sit across from a man. I see his face. I see his eyes. Now, does it matter if he wants a hundred dollars of paper or a hundred million dollars of deep-sea drilling equipment? Don't be a fool. He wants respect. He wants love. He wants to be younger. He wants to be attractive. There is no such thing as a product. Don't ever think there is. There is only... sex. Everything... is sex. You understand that what I'm telling you is a universal truth,... Toby.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Okay, I-I am, I'm almost a little concerned that you might be overqualified for the position. [Robert and Gabe chuckle at this, then Gabe stops chuckling] Do you, um, do you think that you are?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Do I look like someone who would waste my own time?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: No. [Robert then nods his head at Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can you... [seems intimidated, clears throat] You are a man of great confidence. Could you speak a little more to that, and, what the role of confidence... would be... in a dialogue with a subordinate?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Will you be heard? Will you have a voice? Will I steamroll over you? Do you feel heard right now, Jim? Do you have a voice, right now? You can answer me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: That was your choice, not mine. The fallacy is that it is up to the steamroller. It is up to the object... whether it will be flattened or not, and I can tell from the small interaction we've had already, you won't be flattened by anybody. Do you agree with me, Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [more emphatically than Jim] Yes. You do. [nods at the Search Committee, then looks over at the camera with a smirk on his face]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Robert leaves the conference room and looks at the others in the office as he grins at the camera and leaves] He creeps me out. [Toby nods] But, I think he might be a genius.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Jim points at Darryl to be the next interviewee] Good luck, Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [pats Andy on the back] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Think about it! What other mammal, besides humans, drinks the milk of another mammal? I mean, you don't see a bear drinking raccoon milk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Jim and Gabe laugh, Toby smiles and nods] Oh.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: So this is cool. I think we make a good fit. [stands up]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Oh? Uh... we haven't started the interview yet. Were you-were you joking?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Uh... [looks at camera] yes?! I was. [sits back down] Little joke!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: So, how would you go about settling interpersonal conflicts within the office?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I thought that was your job.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, it's one of my strengths, but it's the manager's job.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, for instance, how did you deal with it when two warehouse guys got into a fight?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'll answer that, Jim. I would use it as an opportunity to teach, uh, about actions... and consequences... of actions. [Jim and Gabe stare at Darryl]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [noticing Erin in the background leading a black man dressed in a suit through the office] Who's that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [ignoring Darryl's question] So I think all we need is a resume, and we'll be good right?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I... I just thought you knew me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, it's no big deal, just something that looks like that. [shows Darryl a resume] Cool? [goes to put the resume away]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Let me... [Jim shows him the resume again, Darryl looks at it a little longer this time] Oh. Cool. [Jim gives Darryl a thumbs-up, then looks at the camera as Darryl gets up to leave]

quotes.speaker: Merv
quotes.text: [at the cafe on the first floor] Did, uh, you just interview?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Ohh, unfortunately, yes.

quotes.speaker: Merv
quotes.text: What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: That business can't attract anyone. It's awful up there. Those people seem like they're in prison, waiting out life sentences in a... dying industry.

quotes.speaker: Merv
quotes.text: Place must be horrible. I don't know if I want this job. [gets on elevator]

quotes.speaker: Merv
quotes.text: [in elevator] Well, if I get this job offer, and then I know that I'm gonna take it, and if I take it, I know that I'm never gonna quit, and then 25 years are gonna go by and... I'm gonna die here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What makes you feel qualified to judge a place after a mere interview? [Robert stares at Dwight] What are you doing..? [Dwight sits up abruptly] Stop trying to figure me out.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I just did.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You can't.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: It's done.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, it's not.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I know you now, your nature. I'm done. Not worth continuing. [at the same time, Dwight says:

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm gonna prevent inferior men from sullying my place of work with their weak, passionless leadership. Do you see my hat? No? That's because I just threw it in the ring.

quotes.speaker: Merv
quotes.text: You guys pay for relocation, though, right?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, why would you need relocation, if you already live in Scranton?

quotes.speaker: Merv
quotes.text: Well, I'd want to move further away, you know? Just... I don't want any chance to run into my co-workers outside the office.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can I ask why you're leaving your current job?

quotes.speaker: Merv
quotes.text: [pulls out a tupperware from his briefcase and takes out a tupperware] I'm leaving my other job because they were all jerks, really. [opens tupperware] You know, all of 'em. You had your jerk-wads, and your jerk-offs, so, just between the wads and the offs, I just... I had to get outta there. [begins eating sandwich]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is this a bad time to be doing this?

quotes.speaker: Merv
quotes.text: I'm having a bad time. [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I'm sorry, if we did something to upset you, I'm sure it was inadvertent.

quotes.speaker: Merv
quotes.text: [continues to chew, slower and slower, appears confused] Wait.

quotes.speaker: Merv
quotes.text: Oh, why did I believe that weirdo in the lobby? These are the nicest people I ever met.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [limo driver lets Angela out of the limo at the office parking lot] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [looking at an engagement ring on Angela's finger] It's gorgeous, Angela.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah, I actually know about nice rings and it is gorgeous.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [looks at ring, whispering] Wow...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's a little flashy. I mean, what am I? Naomi Judd?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Tell us the freaking story!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah! Tell us a story.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay. He took me to the replica of Monet's Japanese bridge, and then he put this flower behind my ear, which normally, I would hate, 'cause it's so civil rightsy. Then he got down on one knee, and he said, will you be a Senator's wife?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughing] Oh-ho-ho! He talked about himself in the third person?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes, Pam. Not everyone is as informal as you and Jim. [imitating Jim's voice] Oh, hey Pam, dude, whatever, wanna marry me? [Erin, Kelly, and Meredith laugh]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's not accurate.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Then I saw flashes. Reporters were there. They always find us. And everyone was crying, even his aide. [camera pans and shows Oscar in disbelief]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Angela's engaged to a gay man. As a gay man, I'm horrified. As a friend of Angela's, horrified. As a lover of elegant weddings, [smiles] I'm a little excited. [expression becomes serious again] But overall, horrified.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy? You all set?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay, guys, it's time. It's pep talk time. Tell me what I need to hear.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Are you sure this is a good idea? I hate to see you disappointed.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [grunts] Augh.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I think Andy should be the boss. He's just so great. If I'm being objective, then Darryl, of course.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, Andy, what improvements would you make as office manager?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: For starters, I really think we can streamline communication around here... [gets cut off by Gabe]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Whoa! That's a very heavy accusation to level against Toby.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I wasn't acc-, accusing...

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Well, Toby's in charge of Human Resources, that would include communication. I think that Toby's done a fine job.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Right! I really wasn't trying to insult any, anyone.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I didn't think you were.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I have two relationships with Andy. I have a personal relationship, and I have a professional relationship. Personally, yeah, I think he's a rat, and I think he's responsible for the demise of my relationship with Erin. Professionally,... he broke up the happiest couple in this office!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: How many windows are there in New York City?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Critical thinking. Common, on-the-spot question asked in an interview.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay. Let me think... are you counting car windows?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: No... How far away is the Sun?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [happily] Uh, 93 million miles.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Gabe] Is it?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah! And the diameter of the Sun is 870,000 miles, which makes it 109 times wider than the Earth, and... [Gabe looks visibily annoyed] 333,000 times heavier than the Earth,...

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Shut up about the Sun! SHUT UP about the SUN! [slams fist, hurting his hand]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [alone in his car] I am unhappy with the confusing and, at times, confrontational nature of that meeting. I wanted it to go better. I WANTED IT TO GO BETTER!!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [on phone] Yes, there used to be a paper clip that would pop up and say "Looks like you are writing a letter or resume. Would you like help? I believe his name was... [looks embarrassed at camera] Clippy.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [on phone] First of all, I want to thank you for your years of patronizing our company. I've got some bad news. We're going out of business. [covers phone, whispers to Pam] Saving face. [uncovers phone] Yep, yep. I understand that. Basically everything is falling apart here. Pam looks around the office and realizes only she has overheard this]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How is this on me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hang up. [Creed hangs up] Corporate needs you to find the differences between this picture and this picture. [shows Creed two similar-looking photos of some building] Intel has told us there were at least seven.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [takes the pictures] Okay I already see one, gimme. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: They're the same picture.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, I manage my department, and I've been doing that for several years now. And, god, I've learned a lot of life lessons along the way.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Your department's just you, right?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yes, Jim, but I am not easy to manage.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Great! [to Jim and Toby] Um, can we just... [does a "wrap it up" motion with his pen]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What was that?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: We just have a lot of serious candidates to get through today, so... [nods]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [getting upset] Am I not a serious candidate?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: What do you want me to say? I mean, there's a line of qualified people out there. We have a video CV from England. [to Jim and Toby] Are we all just gonna pretend to- okay. [to Kelly] Um, what are your weaknesses?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I don't have any, assh***.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [comes in, slapping some papers on the table] I want an interview.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [walking with Jim in the parking lot] How's the family?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good. They good?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What's your daughter's name again? Peepee?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Peepa.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Peepa, how is she?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Great! Oh, that's great... We never were very good at small talk, were we, Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Now, listen,...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're not getting an interview, Dwight. The whole point of this Search Committee process is to prevent hiring someone like you ever again.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, I know why you're saying that, Jim, I really do, but think of it this way. The hand that reaches from the grave to grip your throat [motions to grip Jim's throat] is the strong hand you want on the wheel.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [pulls Dwight's arm down] Okay. That's vivid.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm going to make you an offer. Okay? You even do so little as grant me an interview, I will guarantee you your dream work life. Okay? You roll in at 10 a.m. to your own private reserved parking spot, pick up your daily free coffee from Dwight's Caffeine Corner, unlimited sex breaks for you and Pam...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yikes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Erin will eat garbage for your entertainment.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, you know how I like taking bribes. [both smile]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ha ha! [pats Jim on the back]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Unfortunately, Jo also took the job away from you because she doesn't trust your judgment. So how would that look for me, if I recommended you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fine. I'll do it without you, but you'll regret this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me get that for you. [runs ahead to open the door for Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. [looks ashamed]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Pam... I think Robert is gay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The Senator? [Oscar nods] He was married before, and he has a kid.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [whispers] So!?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And don't say that thing about how lots of gay guys have kids.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I have a very strong suspicion.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Did you see him at a bathhouse?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What bathhouse?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The windowless building by the Baskin Robbins.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [confused, whispers] What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Forget it. I'm never gonna know what goes on there.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: My friend at the Scranton Blade is totally plugged into these matters.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're in the gay mafia.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You're thinking of another group. Much wealthier, much older. [whispers, smiles] You sound ignorant.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You guys, um, talking Senator?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No. Why would we be talking about the Senator?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: 'Cause he's totally gay? [walks away]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um, how do I know that Robert is gay? He "liked" my facebook photos at 3 o'clock in the morning.

quotes.speaker: David Brent
quotes.text: [on video resume on a laptop] Name? David Brent. Occupation? Inspirer. Status? None of your business. Young, free, and single, though. Thanks for asking. Hear you're looking for a new boss. Yeah? Someone to tell a bunch of discontented, underencouraged drones what to do every day. Is that it? Oh. Our out-of-touch powers that be? Want me to fire them, if they don't see things your way? Then I ain't that dude. Bye-bye, baby, bye-bye. Get some other corporate suit to lay down the law. What? You've changed your mind? You're now looking for a leader of men? Ipso facto, women too. [points at self] When do I start? Yeah. [Jim looks uninterested in this candidate]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Do you know what it took to get Bob to notice me? I waited in his office every morning wearing nothing but kitty-cat ears. I did that every day for two weeks. And on the tenth day he walked in, he was naked too, except a dog nose. Guess what we did then?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [trying to cut off Phyllis] I... I don't think I can do that.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Bestiality. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well, that's not my personality.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: If my daughter were asking me... [both giggle]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I would say, if you want someone, if you really want them,... go get them.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I do really want him.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: So, uh... here you go. [gives resume to Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hope it's all right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm sure it's fine.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: The guy who was in here earlier, interviewed after me, how'd he do?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Howard Cline?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Ehh, that's not who I'm talking about.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [checks sheet] Oh... Deshaun Williams.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yes. How did he do?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He's an amazing man. He's a Rhodes Scholar. He invented an app that invents apps. Fantastic kisser...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Come on man. I'm being serious. Don't joke.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Darryl! We all know you. Your interview is not nearly as important as the other guys. [Darryl taps a couple times on Jim's desk and walks away]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: First, I'll take down the cubicle walls.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: But there aren't...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Symbol of transparency. There'd be no titles. Everyone would have the same job. Same goes for me. I'd take your job, but I'd reject the title.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: A little un-specific.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Everyone would be known for their accomplishments.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's very interesting. Um, I feel like there might be a conflict there, and if a conflict did arise, how would that be dealt with?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Ooh? Yeah. Mm. Scratch everything from before. I tell you what I'd do. Go the other way. More cubicles. More division. Everyone is somebody's boss, and that person can fire the person below them. [overlapping comments by the Search Committee] At least once a month, the lowest performing person... [does a cut-throat hand gesture] bye bye!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: How would you compare, like, an accountant and HR?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, I'll tell you how. Shall I? I'll tell you how.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: By splitting the difference. Just... just, somewhere in the middle.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think that's probably all we need to hear from...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Zen office. Hmm? Thought of that? That's what I'd do. Everyone takes their shoes off, before they come in. Okay. There'd be no desks. You just sit on the floor.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's very...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: You've got a Thai woman, out in the back. Sockee! Sockee!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Okay, that's not gonna be...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Sockee!... is her name. Okay? Shes administering massage, all right, if you need it. If you don't, whatever, just talk to her! She's a person! Either way, 50 minutes of that and you...you are cracking to go. [smiles]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Is there a front runner?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what? They all just sort of blend together after a while.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well, there must be someone who stands out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, not at all. In fact, I'm not even taking it seriously. I think at the end of the day, I'm just gonna pick a name out of the hat.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: The hell you will! I worked for the last boss for 15 years. According to my doctor, I don't have another 15 years if I want to keep up the same dietary and sexual lifestyle, which I intend to.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [in mock seriousness] Oh no, Stanley... you'll live forever...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: My next boss will be my last boss. He'll be at my funeral. So I would appreciate it if you would take this seriously. [dunks his half-eaten donut in Jim's coffee, takes it back out, and leaves]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh-

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You pick a crappy boss, you're responsible for my crappy life. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, everybody, I was just making a joke. I am taking it seriously, I promise.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Are you? [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Little advice? Take a day off from the whole Jim schtick. Try caring about something. You might like how it feels... James. [closes his office door, leaving Jim alone in the break room]

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: [walks in with her dogs] Gabe, honey! Oh, lord. Take all this. [gives the dog leashes and multiple bags to Gabe]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Here. Jim! Did you hear Stern this morning?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, was it good?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Ohh, Robin was good. She's always good. Keeps him on his toes. Its Howard's show though. [picks up resume from Jim's desk] Whose is this? Darryl Philbin. Ohh. Very nice to see a familiar face on top. Ah... a little long aren't we? Four pages? Is this the same Darryl Philbin who's had two jobs in ten years at one company?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yes, thanks to you, who promoted me, after we, uh, interfaced.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Coordinated and implemented receipt storage and delivery of over 2.5 billion units of inventory. 2.5 billion, Darryl? 2.5 billion units of what?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Paper material, ma'am.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Paper material?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [softly] Pieces of paper. [Jo rolls her eyes]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [clears throat] Jo, may I speak to you for a second?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Or what? You gonna shoot me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ha ha ha! Ha ha ha! Ohh, I enjoy laughing at my mistakes, because I've learned so much from them. I'd like to be interviewed for the position.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: I'll interview you right now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Question 1. Ever shot a gun in the office?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's complicated.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Yeah, but see... it's not.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I don't think we should tell her. Angela went a whole day without telling me I had lettuce in my teeth. Screw her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm a woman. I would want to know.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yeah, you gotta know.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Okay, but if Angela can get a gay man to marry her, maybe I could get a lesbian to marry me? Huh? Huh? That's hot.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You have met a lesbian in real life, right?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You know, this is probably is her last chance at a family.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: She does seem happy.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You're right. You're right. She seems happy. We don't tell her.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: We don't tell her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Excuse me, Ms. Bennett, may I have a word?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Uh,... can it be in private? [to Gabe] Don't worry, it's not about you. [Gabe smiles and leaves] As Minority Executive, I think it's my responsibility to let you know that Gabe is gross. I don't think it's professional that he was sleeping with the receptionist, and then when Erin dumped him, so that she could be with Andy, he became a total crazy stalker psycho.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Welcome to Scranton, Jo. Land of a thousand problems only you can fix. [Jo's phone starts vibrating, she picks it up and sees Dwight has texted her "Dwight's ability as a manager has lead him to higher levels of proffesional success,"] Oh for god's sake. He's texting me his resume one line at a time. These are costing me ten cents a piece, you jackass! I'm roaming!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [to Jordan] Get me our biggest client on the phone, right this instant. [closes his office door]

quotes.speaker: Jordan
quotes.text: Who is our biggest client?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, just put him through to me.

quotes.speaker: Jordan
quotes.text: [laughs] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hello! This is... the client.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: It's Creed. FYI, I'm starting my own paper company, looking to poach some chumps, you in?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hehehe, cool. Let's keep this on the QT, okay? I uh, I don't want you to be a dead mamma jamma.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: All right, thank you, bye-bye.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you, bye-bye.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [knocks and enters] Jo, you have one more candidate. He's a burn victim.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Huh?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [motions toward her face] He's all messed up. I can tell him to get lost if you want.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: No, send him in. [to Search Committee] Who is this?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I have no idea.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [seeing Dwight wearing sunglasses and whose face and hands are completely covered in gauze] Oh, I know this guy. [Dwight awkwardly hands copies of his resume to the Search Committee] Hello! Mr. "Soo-ven-yay." Mr. "Jacques Soo-ven-yay." Nice to meet you. It says here you're French. [Dwight nods] So you worked at your last job for 15 years as Assistant to the Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [mumbling through the gauze] Assistant Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Assistant to the Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [again] Assistant Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What is it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [in a cheesy French accent] Assistant Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, that's my mistake, sorry about that. The last paper company you worked for burned to the ground? And all because they wouldn't hire a manager who lived and breathed paper? That's a travesty.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: I want to talk to Dwight Schrute for a second. I want to ask him a question. [Gabe gets up to leave] If he isn't here in sixty seconds...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uhh. Wait. Wait! No. Stop! Stop. Jo... [takes off sunglasses and reveals his face] It's me. I'm Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [looks extremely confused] No. No! Wait, but, I mean, you're Dwight, and then... he's the... [trails off]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispers] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [looks astonished] Ohhhh!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Very unprofessional, "Jacques." Or, should I say, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Let's just say I had hired this Jack Souvenir. Then what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I would have dressed this way every day, legally changed my name, learned French sign language, shown up, and been the best damn branch manager you'd ever seen!

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: All that for this job.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: That's f***ing crazy. [Jo and Dwight both smile] Get outta here. [Dwight leaves] What a nutjob.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This guy was good. Although, he did keep saying that he needed two weeks off right at the beginning for a trip to the finger lakes. Seriously. Every five minutes, he was like, "just making sure the finger lakes thing is clear."

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Okay, it's fun to talk about the rejects, but uh, who's got ya excited?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Finger Lakes guy is good. Darryl is also very good.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Who's this fella? Went to Cornell. What's wrong with him?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: How much time do you have? Sales ability? None. Integrity? See sales ability. [makes a "zero" hand gesture]

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: And that's your unbiased opinion.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Yes, it is.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: So it's not relevant that he took the receptionist away from you?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Oh, Jo. Jo, I'm disappointed in you. Some people let personal things into the workpl-. Is she with him? Because I thought that she was...

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Gabe...ugh... you got all close to these people. Got involved in their lives. Let's get you back to Florida. We'll figure out something for you.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: That sounds like a promotion!

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: It's not. Let's get Kelly in here to take his place.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um... why Kelly?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: 'Cause Gabe's tall and weak. She's short and strong. I'm doing an opposites thing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: How'd my girl Nellie do?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I didn't know you knew her?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: She didn't mention it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Integrity move. I like it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know, she also gave me a reason to think that maybe she wasn't a good fit.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Well, I'm not saying you must hire her. If you find someone who's clearly a fit, then fine. Just make sure they fit real good. No more manager turnover. Don't mess this up, Jim. And give Dwight an interview. I like a little bit of crazy.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [hiding under desk, raises a sock puppet up, talking in high-pitched voice] Ahh!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Erin, what are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I've been turned into a puppet!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay. [walks away]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [giggling, walks to Erin's desk] Look at the puppet! Hi, puppet! Who are you?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I went to drop off the FedEx forms and an evil witch named Angela turned me into a puppet!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [giggles] Yeah. Low blow, puppet.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: And there's only one thing that can change me back into a real girl.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It's good. It's just that I wish the puppets would talk more about the alphabet. Not for me... but, if any kids are watching... A, B, and so forth. You know,... M-N-L-O, P... F...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [as sock puppet] I need the most special thing in the office.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Silence?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: A date with the best salesman... Andy Bernard! [Andy walks over to Erin's desk]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, Erin.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [gets up] Oh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Where'd you learn how to puppet like that?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [shrugs] I've done it all my life.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Listen, I'm really flattered, but I don't think we should.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Erin's my best friend in this office, hands down, but... when she asked me out, I just didn't have that feeling, you know? [clip jumps ahead] Aren't there some things that you really want to like, but you just can't... seem to like it, like, Mad Men... or football... [clips jumps ahead] Let's not forget, Erin chose Gabe over me. That happened. I'm not going to apologize for getting over her, okay? I'm sorry. [clip jumps ahead] I would go for someone who's more... she's great, though.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [loudly] Stanley, I won't be able to invite everyone to the wedding, because we want to keep it to 350.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I'll get over it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I mean, we just have to see how many Senators and members of Congress want to attend, before we can open it up to regular people. Pam, you know how you and Jim did your ironic wedding? [Pam looks confused] Do you still have the plans for the dream wedding that you couldn't afford?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That was our dream wedding.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Niagara Falls? Pregnant? That was your dream? Pork medallions?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [looks over at Oscar, who is quietly watching this happen] I hope... you have a very beautiful wedding, Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right. Name.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dwight Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you, Mr. Schnoot. [closes his binder] We will let you know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You have to interview me...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just did. The answer to that one question told me everything I need to know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I demand more questions!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [ignoring Dwight] All right, guys, good day, a lot of candidates. Let's discuss.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay! If you're not going to interview me, then I'll do it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What will be your first priority? I will have seven first priorities. Safety, profits, fostering a community of self-reliance and entrepreneurship, listening, respect for human life, bolstering our public image, and... [chuckles] getting everyone home on time. Dwight, let me be frank. In an accident that no one can blame you for, an antique gun was discharged while you were acting manager. How are we ever to trust you again? [whispering] That's a great question. [Jim nods] I am going to institute a strict no-firearms policy for this office that extends to myself as well. Wow. All of my concerns are disappearing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you. [clears throat and gets up] You'll be hearing from us shortly, Mr. Schrute, and I think you're gonna like the call you're going to receive. [smiles] Oh, come on. I'm just happy that I got this meeting. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, that was quick.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [sighs] Very, very interesting. And you know what? I'm impressed.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He's not a real candidate.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I don't know, Jim, 'cause, makes me think about something my grandfather used to say, which is that, sometimes, the hand that jumps out of the grave and grabs you around the throat; that is the hand that you want on the wheel.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You took the deal.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah, it was a great deal.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's not okay.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I don't know. Dwight seems like a great leader to me, and I look forward to the personal perks that he promised me privately. What do you think, Toby?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, we could try him out for a little while... [Jim drops his pen, looks exasperated] and if it doesn't work out, you know, maybe one of us could, you know, step in...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What is happening right now?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Is it true that you're making Dwight the manager?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, why would you think that?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: He and Kelly said, then they pre-fired me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. [walks out of conference room] Okay, guys, just so you all know, no decision has been made, and Dwight is definitely not the boss.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That is correct. Actually, Dwight is not the manager yet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no, no. Not ever, 'cause that's not gonna happen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, it's not entirely up to you, is it? Seems to me like someone's getting a little power-mad.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Am I the only one who remembers what he did when he was in charge? I feel like I'm going a little bit crazy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Tuna... You're completely sane.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Who do you like for the job? Is there anyone who maybe was a little underwhelming at first, but now seems like a safe, if not slightly unexciting, choice?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, seems like everybody has an opinion. So, who else? Anybody?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Do you mean it? Anybody? Are you sure?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [while sighing] I suppose I am.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Okay... well what do 'I' want in a manager?... let me see. [walks slowly across the office] what do 'I' want?...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't think he meant, that-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: So now anyone gets to talk at any times?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What do 'I' want?... I'm looking for someone... who... [smiles] Everyone is listening to me. [Dwight looks at the camera, annoyed]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Can I say...?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I think it should be Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What a surprise! Minorities sticking together.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Kelly's on your side.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I'm sorry, is that all you think of me? A minority? I am so much more than that. I am a dancer, I'm a singer, I'm a fashion designer.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoever it is, I think they should be lame. [Stanley shakes his head and rolls his eyes] Kind a a non-threatening, moderate personality.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I want an outsider.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Perfect. There are several outside candidates that we think would be really-

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, I mean an outsider. Like someone on the margins of society, who doesn't see things the way we do, like a homeless person.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A homeless person. Really? A homeless person.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, you're right, Pam, let's just leave him to the welfare system and let that handle it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I want you to say that you think the 'best' person to be our new manager is a homeless person.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Let me guess who you want, Pam. Rachael Ray? The ladies of The View?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I got away with... everything, under the last boss, and it wasn't good for me, at all. So, I want guidance. I want leadership. But don't just, like, boss me around, you know? Like, lead me. Lead me... when I'm in the mood... to be led.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I just want, for once, a smart, professional, decisive, well-hung man in his forties.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey! Hey! Hey!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Okay, fine. Uhh, the guy with a tiny penis. Are you happy? [sarcastically] Let's hire that guy! [Jim looks speechless]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: She may have a point there... would a small penis work? Small-to-moderate.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [walks in] Gotta catch a plane.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ohh, hey Gabe, I'm sorry, we... we didn't get you a cake or anything. We're gonna miss you.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Oh, well I'm still the corporate liaison to the branch.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You are not leaving without giving me a hug. [hugs Gabe] Ughh.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Okay, you know what, you don't need to make that sound.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I'm sorry! You were just a lot bonier than I thought you were gonna be!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: There are plenty of people who love touching me. [camera zooms to Ryan, who looks at the camera, extremely skeptical] I'm a terrific hugger. I've been with a bunch of girls where that's basically all they want to do. I will see you all soon.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Later, man.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: [various] Good luck! Goodbye! Good luck at your new job.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Take care, man.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We're gonna miss you, Gabe. [Gabe leaves]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [stands up] Uh, listen up. Listen up, ladies. I want the job. There, I said it. I'm educated. I'm capable. I like all of you... and I won't make any changes.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I see it. [nods and smiles] I see it like I see a mountain that I'm standing in front of [voice cracks] and facing, and I'm like...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah. [Oscar looks confused] Yeah, Andy would be wonderful as boss. Erin made a good point. [brushes Erin's hair with her hand]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: No, we're not related. I got the call. But... I'll tell her some other day. [smiles]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What about Darryl? We can all agree that he's a stand-up guy, right?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, let me be clear. I only speak for myself, and not myself and the Senator. I think we have some wonderful candidates, and there's a great, lively debate here, but let's think about-

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No, no,... no. Sorry. We cut Kevin off for the same thing. You have to have something to say, if you talk. [Angela rolls her eyes and stops talking]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [enters the office with his daughter, who runs in and hugs Jim] Jada, no, no, no, Jada, what are you doing? [Jim looks knowingly at the camera] Oh. So sorry, guys. I hope my family didn't disrupt your meeting.

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: Daddy, are these the people who are making you manager?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [sighs] Maybe, sweetheart. Single dad. Challenges.

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: I don't know if he'd be a good manager [Jim shakes his head and looks wide-eyed at Darryl], but he's a really great dad!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Okay, shush it. This was a mistake. Let's go. [Darryl and Jada leave, Ryan slowly shakes his head]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It seems like we all know enough to vote. Should we just vote now?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What? No, no, it's not a vote.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Then what was this all about?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know. This conversation really got away from me.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I don't care. They can just vote.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, they can't. That's not how this is gonna work. [exhales] We're going in this room, we're going to have a meeting. We're gonna make a recommendation to Jo, and she's gonna give you her recommendation on Monday. Okay? [to Kelly and Toby, as they re-enter the conference room] What the hell happened out there? [Kevin tries to follow, but the door is closed on him]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sometimes you hear about people failing upwards. I think I'm about to do that.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: This job? Oh, yeah, I'll get it. Jo's an old friend. I think... I'm her best friend. She's not my best friend.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Every day I have a blueberry muffin. Today, I did not have a blueberry muffin. Should have had the blueberry muffin... especially considering how incredibly superstitious I am.

quotes.speaker: Fred
quotes.text: No, I've never been more sure of anything in my life. I will be the new boss of... [looks back to glance at lobby directory] Vance Refrigeration.

quotes.speaker: Merv
quotes.text: Honestly, I think I... I sabotaged myself. It's like I'm afraid of being happy. Case in point... I was supposed to start another job today.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [chuckles] I will get offered the job. That's a... call I've received many times. The slight hopefulness in their voice, the pregnant pause... while they wait to hear my response, and then... my response.

quotes.speaker: Finger Lakes Guy
quotes.text: [geeky voice] I want the job. I really do. It's just, the rest of my family's in the Finger Lakes right now. I'm supposed to be in the Finger Lakes right now. I told them I was on a hike; snuck away to do this interview. I gotta get back pretty soon; they'll worry. People disappear in the Finger Lakes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I will run this branch, or I will destroy this branch, or... [shrugs] I don't know. Something always works out. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: You remind me so much of my fourth-biggest client.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [in high-pitched, damsel-like voice] Is that right?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I think you two should meet.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, okay!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hey Jordana! Patch my ninth- and fourth-biggest clients together. [Pam puts down phone and picks it back up]

quotes.speaker: {Pam} as "fourth-biggest client"
quotes.text: [in a comedic male voice] Hello!

quotes.speaker: {Pam} as "ninth-biggest client"
quotes.text: [in high-pitched, damsel-like voice] Hello!

quotes.speaker: {Pam} as "fourth-biggest client"
quotes.text: Hi, how are ya? [Erin looks amused, Stanley and Phyllis look at Pam, confused]

quotes.speaker: {Pam} as "ninth-biggest client"
quotes.text: Ohho! I'm good! Don't you just love paper, and things about paper!

quotes.speaker: {Pam} as "fourth-biggest client"
quotes.text: Hey, are you single? This seems like a love connection to me!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: It's Kismet!
